newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rubber falls in late trading.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rubber falls in late trading.

text.p: Indonesian tyre-grade SIR20 offer prices fell in late trading on Monday on the back of poor demand, traders said.
"The market is crumbling. Prices are falling and buying interest is just zero. It seems that we have no choice but to cut the offer price," said one trader in Palembang, South Sumatra.
Traders in other centres reported similar bearish sentiment, with no bids or deals were heard in the afternoon.
One trader in Bangka island off South Sumatra said he did was holding off sales because of tight supply and also due to the current pepper harvest.
"People's attention is on pepper, whose price is much higher compared with rubber," one trader in Bangka said.
"When pepper is still hot, it's better for us to wait a bit. In addition, supply (rubber) is very tight here at the moment," he said.
Traders said offer prices were quoted at 42.50 U.S. cents/lb fob Palembang for September shipment, 43.00 fob Medan, 42.25 fob Padang and Surabaya and 41.00 fob Pontianak and Jambi.
Traders said supply of raw material had started to improve at a number of centres, raising the possibility of further declines in offer prices.
